mainBoard.name: Armageddon
mainBoard.originalText: All lands in play are destroyed.
mainBoard.text: Destroy all lands.

mainBoard.name: Armageddon Clock
mainBoard.originalText: Put one counter on Armageddon Clock during each of your upkeeps. At the end of your upkeep, each player takes damage equal to the number of counters on the Clock. Any player may spend {4} during any upkeep to remove a counter.

rulings.text: Players can remove as many counters as they can pay for each turn.

mainBoard.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a doom counter on this artifact.
At the beginning of your draw step, this artifact deals damage equal to the number of doom counters on it to each player.
{4}: Remove a doom counter from this artifact. Any player may activate this ability but only during any upkeep step.

foreignData.name: Balance
foreignData.text: Alle Spieler opfern so viele Länder, bis alle Spieler gleichviele Länder im Spiel haben. Der Spieler, der die wenigsten Länder hat, darf aber jetzt keine Länder opfern. Dann gleichen alle Spieler die Anzahl der Karten, die sie auf der Hand haben und die Anzahl der Kreaturen, die sie im Spiel haben, nach der selben Methode einander an.

mainBoard.name: Balance
mainBoard.originalText: Whichever player has more lands in play must discard enough lands of his or her choice to equalize the number of lands both players have in play. Next, equalize the cards in hand and then creatures in play the same way. Creatures lost in this manner are considered buried.

rulings.text: Balance doesn't have targets, so permanents that can't be targeted, such as a creature with shroud or protection from white, are valid choices to be sacrificed.

Each type of object is counted during the corresponding part of the process. Cards in hand are counted after lands have been sacrificed, and creatures on the battlefield are counted after cards have been discarded. Thus, a land creature sacrificed to the first part of the spell would not be counted when determining how many creatures are on the battlefield for the last part.

First the player whose turn it is chooses which lands (if any) to keep, then each other player in turn order does the same. Each player will know the choices made by the players who chose before them. All of the unchosen lands are then sacrificed simultaneously. Then the process is repeated for cards in hand, except that no cards are revealed until all players have chosen what to discard, at which point those cards are all discarded simultaneously. Lastly, the process is repeated for creatures, and players will again know earlier choices made when deciding what to sacrifice. All of the unchosen creatures are then sacrificed simultaneously.

mainBoard.text: Each player chooses a number of lands they control equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Players discard cards and sacrifice creatures the same way.

mainBoard.name: Black Lotus
mainBoard.originalText: Adds 3 mana of any single color of your choice to your mana pool, then is discarded. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.
mainBoard.text: {T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add three mana of any one color.

foreignData.name: Segen
foreignData.text: {W}: Die verzauberte Kreatur erhält +1/+1 bis zum Ende des Zuges.

mainBoard.name: Blessing
mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature
{W}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

mainBoard.name: Bottle of Suleiman
mainBoard.originalText: {4}: Flip a coin, with opponent calling heads or tails while coin is in the air. If the flip ends up in opponent's favor, Bottle of Suleiman does 5 damage to you. Otherwise, a 5/5 flying Djinn immediately comes into play on your side. Use a counter to represent Djinn. Djinn is treated exactly like a normal artifact creature except that if it leaves play it is removed from the game entirely. No matter how the flip turns out, Bottle of Suleiman is discarded after use.

rulings.text: The coin is flipped on resolution and not on declaration of the ability.

mainBoard.text: {1}, Sacrifice this artifact: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, create a 5/5 colorless Djinn artifact creature token with flying. If you lose the flip, this artifact deals 5 damage to you.

mainBoard.name: Circle of Protection: Artifacts
mainBoard.originalText: {2}: Prevents all damage against you from any one artifact source. If a source does damage to you more than once in a turn, you must pay {2} each time you want to prevent the damage.
mainBoard.text: {2}: The next time an artifact source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

foreignData.name: Dingus-Ei
foreignData.text: Jedesmal, wenn ein sich im Spiel befindliches Land auf den Friedhof gelegt wird, fügt das Dingus-Ei dessen Beherrscher 2 Schadenspunkte zu.

mainBoard.name: Dingus Egg
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever anyone loses a land, Dingus Egg does 2 damage to that player for each land lost.
mainBoard.text: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, this artifact deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

foreignData.name: Entzauberung
foreignData.text: Zerstöre eine Verzauberung oder ein Artefakt.

mainBoard.name: Disenchant
mainBoard.originalText: Target enchantment or artifact is destroyed.

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

mainBoard.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

mainBoard.flavorText: Though he eventually came to despise Tocasia, Mishra listened well to her lessons on clarity of purpose. Unlike his brother, he focused his mind on a single goal.
mainBoard.name: Mishra's Workshop
mainBoard.originalText: Tap to add 3 colorless mana to your mana pool. This mana may only be used to cast artifacts.

rulings.text: The mana can't be used to pay Echo costs.
This mana may be used on additional costs to cast the spell, such as Kicker.
This mana may not be used to pay costs imposed after the spell is initially cast.
You can spend the mana on costs on the spell's text.

mainBoard.text: {T}: Add {C}{C}{C}. Spend this mana only to cast artifact spells.

mainBoard.name: Mox Pearl
mainBoard.originalText: Add 1 white mana to your mana pool. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.
mainBoard.text: {T}: Add {W}.

foreignData.name: Eigene Inkarnation
foreignData.text: Der Beherrscher kann Teile oder den ganzen Schaden, der der Inkarnation zugefügt wird, auf sich selber umleiten. Wird die Inkarnation vernichtet, verliert ihr Beherrscher die (aufgerundete) Hälfte seiner Lebenspunkte. Effekte, die Schaden verhindern oder umleiten, können hier nicht angewendet werden, um diesen Verlust an Lebenspunkten zu verhindern.

mainBoard.name: Personal Incarnation
mainBoard.originalText: Caster can redirect any or all damage done to Personal Incarnation to self instead. The source of the damage is unchanged. If Personal Incarnation goes to the graveyard, caster loses half his or her remaining life points, rounding up the loss.

rulings.text: The owner of the Incarnation loses life when it is destroyed, not the controller. So if you control your opponent's Incarnation you can let it die to make them lose life.
You do not lose life if this card is exiled or sent someplace without going to the graveyard first.
If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0. This means that the life total stays the same. A life total of -10 would remain -10.

mainBoard.text:
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to this creature this turn is dealt to its owner instead. Only this creature's owner may activate this ability.
When this creature dies, its owner loses half their life, rounded up.

{1}: First strike until end of turn.
{W}{W}: +0/+0, +1/+0 or +2/+0 until end of turn chosen at random.

mainBoard.flavorText: Born with wings of light and a sword of faith, this heavenly incarnation embodies both fury and purity.

Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

mainBoard.name: Sol Ring
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Add 2 colorless mana to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt.
mainBoard.text: {T}: Add {C}{C}.

foreignData.name: Schwerter zu Pflugscharen
foreignData.text: Nimm eine Kreatur ganz aus dem Spiel. Ihr Beherrscher erhält dafür so viele Lebenspunkte wie die Kreatur Stärke hatte.

mainBoard.name: Swords to Plowshares
mainBoard.originalText: Target creature is removed from game entirely. Creature's controller gains life points equal to creature's power.

rulings.text: Use the power of the creature from when it was last on the battlefield to determine how much life is gained.

mainBoard.text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

mainBoard.flavorText: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the knight had just laid waste.
mainBoard.name: White Knight
mainBoard.originalText: Protection from black, first strike
mainBoard.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)

mainBoard.name: White Mana Battery
mainBoard.originalText:
{2}ocT: Put one counter on White Mana Battery.
ocT: Add {W} to your mana pool. Remove as many counters as you wish. For each counter removed add {W} to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt.

rulings.text: Can be tapped even if it has no counters.

mainBoard.text:
{2}, {T}: Put a charge counter on this artifact.
{T}, Remove any number of charge counters from this artifact: Add {W}, then add an additional {W} for each charge counter removed this way.

sideBoard.name: Angry Mob
sideBoard.originalText:
Trample
During your turn, the *s below are both equal to the total number of swamps all opponents control. During any other player's turn, * equals 0.
sideBoard.text:
Trample
During your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each equal to 2 plus the number of Swamps your opponents control. During turns other than yours, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each 2.

foreignData.name: Schutzkreis gegen Schwarz
foreignData.text: {1}: Schützt Dich gegen allen Schaden aus einer schwarzen Quelle. Wenn Dir eine Schadensquelle mehr als einmal in einem Zug Schaden zufügt, kannst Du jedesmal 1 zahlen, um den Schaden zu vermeiden.

sideBoard.name: Circle of Protection: Black
sideBoard.originalText: {1}: Prevents all damage against you from one black source. If a source does damage to you more than once in a turn, you must pay 1 mana each time you want to prevent the damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn’t need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

sideBoard.text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

sideBoard.name: Conversion
sideBoard.originalText: All mountains are considered basic plains while Conversion is in play. Pay {W}{W} during upkeep or Conversion is discarded.

rulings.text: The Conversion effect is a continuous effect. There is no chance to tap a just-played mountain for red mana before it becomes a plains.
Will not add or remove the supertype snow to or from a land.

sideBoard.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this enchantment unless you pay {W}{W}.
All Mountains are Plains.

foreignData.name: Karma
foreignData.text: Karma fügt jedem Spieler während seiner Versorgungsphase pro Sumpf, den der jeweilige Spieler im Spiel hat, einen Schadenspunkt zu.

sideBoard.name: Karma
sideBoard.originalText: During a player's upkeep, Karma does 1 point of damage to that player for each swamp he or she has in play.

rulings.text: Amount of damage is determined when the ability resolves and not when it is placed on the stack.

sideBoard.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, this enchantment deals damage to that player equal to the number of Swamps they control.
